page.title: 05THE U.T.S.C. BOURNE END
page.content: Some well-known riparian owners founded the Upper Thames S.C. in 1884.The clubhouse soon became too small ,so the present clubhouse was built in 1890,along a stretch of river long recognised as an attractive boating and sailing reach. Prospective members are interviewed and must own a boat. Presently there are about 340 members, including non sailing members.Members can leave their boats at the club by paying a mooring fee.About 90 boats form 6 different classes,which enter 4 leagues annually, called series.They race for series points every Sunday, eventually competing for a trophy. During the annual 'Bourne End Week', members and visitors race for 15 different cups,one of which is the 'Queens Cup',presented by Queen Victoria.On Saturdays teaching classes help less experienced racers.
